name: cppcheck-turbo
description: A minimalistic VS Code extension that runs cppcheck on C/C++ files upon save and shows issues in the Problems panel. compile_commands.json and .cppcheck-config files are used to configure Cppcheck.
author: Emiel Esti√©venart

cppcheck-turbo.enable.description: Enable or disable the Cppcheck Turbo extension.

cppcheck-turbo.minSeverity.description: Minimum severity of issues to report (info, warning, or error).

cppcheck-turbo.compileCommandsPath.description: The path relative to the workspace to the compile_commands file. If empty, uses the workspace root.

cppcheck-turbo.path.description: Path to the cppcheck executable. If empty, uses 'cppcheck' from the system PATH.

cppcheck-turbo.useCompileCommands.description: Enable or disable the Cppcheck Turbo usage of compile_commands.json. If this is disable you will need to configure the compile commands yourself in the .cppcheck-config.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
